tutorial.title: Linking Webpages
tutorial.descriptionContent: Learn how to create websites by linking local webpages together.

lessons.title: Other computers
lessons.interactiveContent:
So far we've seen how to link to webpages on different computers.

Make sure to pick href, followed by =, and finally "https://google.com".

lessons.title: Linking local webpages
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can access local webpages like trail.html by adding / before the file name, just like with local images.

Make sure to pick /, followed by trail.html.

lessons.title: Files
lessons.interactiveContent: Webpages are .html files and the main webpage, or homepage, is usually named index.html. You can usually see this page in the search bar.

lessons.title: Naming convention
lessons.interactiveContent:
To keep .html file names easy to read, we lowercase each word and place a hyphen - in between.

Make sure to pick /markup-quiz.html.

lessons.title: Websites
lessons.interactiveContent: We place .html files in the same folder. Linking these local webpages to each other is how we create a website.

lessons.title: Navigation
lessons.interactiveContent:
Websites typically have visible links to their most common webpages. Here, we link to index.html, glossary.html, and contact.html.

Make sure to pick /contact.html.

lessons.title: Question: Short URL
lessons.interactiveContent:
What type of link does this webpage have?

A link to a local webpageA link to webpage on another computer

A link to a local webpage.

lessons.title: Question: Files
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's the name usually given to a website's homepage?

index.htmlabout.html

Make sure to pick index.html.

lessons.title: Question: Webpage
lessons.interactiveContent:
What are webpages?

Files with .html at the endFiles with .png at the end

Files with .html at the end.

lessons.title: Question: Websites
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is a website?

Webpages linked to each otherImages linked to each other

Webpages linked to each other.

lessons.title: Question: Naming convention
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which sign do we add between words when naming a file?

A hyphen -A slash /

A hyphen -.

lessons.title: Question: Navigation
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which link takes the user to another page on the same website?

The first linkThe second link

The first link.

lessons.title: Example: Short URL
lessons.interactiveContent:
Complete the link to the local webpage.

Make sure to pick /.

lessons.title: Example: Files
lessons.interactiveContent:
Link to a webpage by adding the correct file name.

Make sure to pick /stocks.html.

lessons.title: Example: Naming convention
lessons.interactiveContent:
Link to a webpage by adding the correct file name.

Make sure to pick /social-media-quiz.html.

lessons.title: Example: Navigation
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add the links to local files in their correct positions.

Make sure to pick "/index.html", followed by "/top-secret.html", and finally "/contact.html".

executableContent.instructions: Add an `a` element that links to `/top-secret.html` and displays `Top Secret`.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
CIA Webpage

Homepage Contact

Welcome to the CIA Homepage. We've been expecting you!
files.solvedContent:
CIA Webpage

Homepage Top Secret Contact

Welcome to the CIA Homepage. We've been expecting you!

files.name: top-secret.html
files.content:
CIA Webpage

Homepage Secret Files Sign up

Login
